node.name: MODembed
node.shortdescription:
MODembed is an experimental IDE aiming to provide a more advanced toolchain for embedded software development. It provides a model-based approach for defining the whole compilation process.

Features:

  • Model-based approach - everything is a model: program, device and architecture
  • Compilation is a modeling workflow - User gets full control over compilation process
  • Device- and platform-independent toolchain - program and target architecture model are differentiated
  • Support for reverse-engineering Disassembling and decompiling programs
  • Included libraries
    • Microchip PIC 8-bit architectures
      • Midrange (Pic16) and enchanced midrange (Pic16E) instruction set and generated libraries
      • High-end (Pic18) instruction set and generated libraries
      • Support for configuration bits
node.body:
MODembed is an experimental IDE aiming to provide a more advanced toolchain for embedded software development. It provides a model-based approach for defining the whole compilation process.

Features:

  • Model-based approach - everything is a model: program, device and architecture
  • Compilation is a modeling workflow - User gets full control over compilation process
  • Device- and platform-independent toolchain - program and target architecture model are differentiated
  • Support for reverse-engineering Disassembling and decompiling programs
  • Included libraries
    • Microchip PIC 8-bit architectures
      • Midrange (Pic16) and enchanced midrange (Pic16E) instruction set and generated libraries
      • High-end (Pic18) instruction set and generated libraries
      • Support for configuration bits
